Typealiases.html#/s:10ConsoleKit12Comman.name: CommandGroup

Structs/ConsoleLogger.html#/s:10ConsoleK.name: console

Structs/ConsoleStyle.html#/s:10ConsoleKi.name: color

Structs/ConsoleStyle.html#/s:10ConsoleKi.abstract: Optional background color. If nil background is plain.

Structs/ConsoleStyle.html#/s:10ConsoleKi.name: plain
Structs/ConsoleStyle.html#/s:10ConsoleKi.abstract: Plain text with no color or background.

Structs/CommandInput.html#/s:10ConsoleKi.abstract: Parses the option from input, returning nil if it could

Structs/CommandInput.html#/s:10ConsoleKi.name: parse(argument:)
Structs/CommandInput.html#/s:10ConsoleKi.abstract: Parses the argument from input, returning nil if it could not be found.

Structs/CommandContext.html#/s:10Console.name: rawArguments
Structs/CommandContext.html#/s:10Console.abstract: A name/value map of the commands arguments that where passed in.

Structs/CommandContext.html#/s:10Console.abstract: Gets an option passed into the command.

Structs/CommandContext.html#/s:10Console.abstract: Requires an option, returning the value or throwing.

Structs/CommandContext.html#/s:10Console.name: argument(_:)
Structs/CommandContext.html#/s:10Console.abstract: Accesses an argument by name. This will only throw if

Structs/AnyCommandContext.html#/s:10Cons.name: context(command:)
Structs/AnyCommandContext.html#/s:10Cons.abstract: Creates an instance of CommandContext<Command> with the data from the current AnyCommandContext instance.

Structs/Commands.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Co.name: commands
Structs/Commands.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Co.abstract: Top-level available commands, stored by unique name.

Structs/Commands.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Co.name: defaultCommand
Structs/Commands.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Co.abstract: If set, this is the default top-level command that should run if no other commands are specified.

Structs/Commands.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Co.name: init(commands:defaultCommand:)
Structs/Commands.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Co.abstract: Creates a new ConfiguredCommands struct. This is usually done by calling resolve(for:) on CommandConfig.

Structs/CommandConfiguration.html#/s:10C.name: resolve()
Structs/CommandConfiguration.html#/s:10C.abstract: Resolves the configured commands to a ConfiguredCommands struct.

Structs/Argument.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Ar.name: help
Structs/Argument.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Ar.abstract: The arguments’s help text when --help is passed in.

Structs/Argument.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Ar.name: type
Structs/Argument.html#/s:10ConsoleKit8Ar.abstract: The type that the argument value gets decoded to.

Structs/Option.html#/s:10ConsoleKit6Opti.name: short
Structs/Option.html#/s:10ConsoleKit6Opti.abstract: The option’s help text when --help is passed in.

Structs/Option.html#/s:10ConsoleKit6Opti.name: optionType
Structs/Option.html#/s:10ConsoleKit6Opti.abstract: The type of command option that the instance represents.

Structs/Option.html#/s:10ConsoleKit6Opti.abstract: The type that the option value gets decoded to.

Structs/Option.html#/s:10ConsoleKit6Opti.abstract: Creates a new Option with the optionType set to .value.

Structs/CustomActivity.html#/s:10Console.name: frames
Structs/CustomActivity.html#/s:10Console.abstract: The text that will be output on the indicator ticks, each frame corresponding to a single tick in a range of 0...(frames.count - 1).

Structs/CustomActivity.html#/s:10Console.name: success
Structs/CustomActivity.html#/s:10Console.abstract: The text to be output with the .success style if the indicator is succeeded.

Structs/CustomActivity.html#/s:10Console.name: failure
Structs/CustomActivity.html#/s:10Console.abstract: The text to be output with the .error style if the indicator is failed.

Structs/CustomActivity.html.name: CustomActivity
Structs/CustomActivity.html.abstract: An activity indicator with customizable frames and success and failure messages.

Structs/Commands.html.name: Commands
Structs/Commands.html.abstract: Represents a top-level group of configured commands. This is usually created by calling resolve(for:) on CommandConfig.

Structs/CommandContext.html.name: CommandContext
Structs/CommandContext.html.abstract: Contains required data for running a command such as the Console and CommandInput.

Structs/CommandInput.html.name: CommandInput
Structs/CommandInput.html.abstract: Raw input for commands. Use this to parse options and arguments for the command context.

Structs/ConsoleStyle.html.name: ConsoleStyle
Structs/ConsoleStyle.html.abstract: Representation of a style for outputting to a Console in different colors with differing attributes.

Structs/ConsoleText.html.name: ConsoleText
Structs/ConsoleText.html.abstract: A collection of ConsoleTextFragments. Represents stylized text that can be outputted

Structs/ConsoleTextFragment.html.name: ConsoleTextFragment
Structs/ConsoleTextFragment.html.abstract: A single piece of ConsoleText. Contains a raw String and the desired ConsoleStyle.

Protocols/AnyArgument.html#/s:10ConsoleK.abstract: The type that the argument value gets decoded to.

Protocols/AnyOption.html#/s:10ConsoleKit.name: valueType
Protocols/AnyOption.html#/s:10ConsoleKit.abstract: The type that the option value gets decoded to.

Protocols/CommandRunnable.html#/s:10Cons.name: signature

Protocols/CommandRunnable.html#/s:10Cons.abstract: Runs the command against the supplied input.

Protocols/AnyCommandRunnable.html#/s:10C.name: anySignature
Protocols/AnyCommandRunnable.html#/s:10C.abstract: An instance of the type that represents the command’s valid inputs/signature.

Protocols/AnyCommandRunnable.html#/s:10C.name: help
Protocols/AnyCommandRunnable.html#/s:10C.abstract: Text that will be displayed when --help is passed.

Protocols/AnyCommandRunnable.html#/s:10C.name: run(using:)
Protocols/AnyCommandRunnable.html#/s:10C.abstract: Runs the command against the supplied input.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: size
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: The size of the Console window. Used for calculating lines printed and centering text.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: input(isSecure:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Returns a String of input read from the Console until a line feed character was found.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs serialized ConsoleText to the Console.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: clear(_:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Clears previously printed Console output according to the ConsoleClear type given.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: report(error:newLine:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs an error to the Console‘s error stream.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: userInfo
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Undocumented

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: customActivity(frames:success:failure:color:)

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: customActivity(frames:success:failure:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Creates an activity indicator with custom frames that are iterated over.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: loadingBar(title:targetQueue:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Creates a new LoadingBar-based ActivityIndicator.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: progressBar(title:targetQueue:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Creates a new ProgressBar-based ActivityIndicator.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: clear(lines:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Deletes lines that were previously printed to the terminal.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: pushEphemeral()
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Pushes a new ephemeral console state. All text outputted to the console immidiately after this call

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: popEphemeral()
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Pops a previous ephemeral console state. All text outputted to the console immidiately after the last call

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: didOutputLines(count:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: This method allows the Console implementation to record how many lines have been printed so

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: run(_:input:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Runs a CommandRunnable (CommandGroup or Command) of commands on this Console using the supplied CommandInput.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: ask(_:isSecure:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Requests input from the console after displaying a prompt.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: choose(_:from:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Prompts the user to choose an item from the supplied array. The chosen item will be returned.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: choose(_:from:display:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Prompts the user to choose an item from the supplied array. The chosen item will be returned.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: confirm(_:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Requests yes / no confirmation from the user after a prompt.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: confirmOverride
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: If set, all calls to confirm(_:) will use this value instead of asking the user.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: input()
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: See Console.input(isSecure:)

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: center(_:padding:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Centers a String according to this console’s size.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: center(_:padding:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Centers an array of Strings according to this console’s size.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: output(_:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs serialized ConsoleText to the Console.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: output(_:style:newLine:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs a String to the Console with the specified ConsoleStyle style.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: print(_:newLine:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs a String to the Console with ConsoleStyle.plain style.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: info(_:newLine:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs a String to the Console with ConsoleStyle.info style.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: success(_:newLine:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs a String to the Console with ConsoleStyle.success style.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: warning(_:newLine:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs a String to the Console with ConsoleStyle.warning style.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: error(_:newLine:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Outputs a String to the Console with ConsoleStyle.error style.

Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.name: wait(seconds:)
Protocols/Console.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0A.abstract: Blocks the current thread for the specified number of seconds.

Protocols/ActivityIndicatorType.html#/s:.name: outputActivityIndicator(to:state:)
Protocols/ActivityIndicatorType.html#/s:.abstract: Draws / renders this ActivityIndicatorType to the Console for the supplied ActivityIndicatorState.

Protocols/ActivityBar.html#/s:10ConsoleK.abstract: The title to display when rendering this ActivityBar.

Protocols/ActivityBar.html#/s:10ConsoleK.name: renderActiveBar(tick:width:)
Protocols/ActivityBar.html#/s:10ConsoleK.abstract: Called each time the ActivityBar should refresh its display.

Protocols/ActivityBar.html#/s:10ConsoleK.name: width
Protocols/ActivityBar.html#/s:10ConsoleK.abstract: Defines the width of all ActivityBars in characters.

Protocols/ActivityBar.html.name: ActivityBar
Protocols/ActivityBar.html.abstract: An ActivityIndicatorType that renders an activity bar on a single line.

Protocols/ActivityIndicatorType.html.name: ActivityIndicatorType
Protocols/ActivityIndicatorType.html.abstract: ActivityIndicatorTypes are responsible for drawing / rendering the current ActivityIndicatorState

Protocols/CommandRunnable.html.name: CommandRunnable
Protocols/CommandRunnable.html.abstract: Capable of being run on a Console using Console.run(...).

Protocols.html#/s:10ConsoleKit7CommandP.name: Command
Protocols.html#/s:10ConsoleKit7CommandP.abstract: A command that can be run through a Console.

Protocols.html#/s:10ConsoleKit16CommandS.name: CommandSignature
Protocols.html#/s:10ConsoleKit16CommandS.abstract: The structure of the inputs that a command can take

Extensions/LoggingSystem.html#/s:7Loggin.name: bootstrap(console:level:metadata:)
Extensions/LoggingSystem.html#/s:7Loggin.abstract: Bootstraps a ConsoleLogger to the LoggingSystem, so that logger will be used in Logger.init(label:).

Extensions/CommandContext/Arguments.html.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Extensions/CommandContext/Arguments.html.abstract: Allows dynamic access to the context’s arguments using the command’s signature’s keypaths.

Extensions/CommandContext/Options.html#/.name: subscript(dynamicMember:)
Extensions/CommandContext/Options.html#/.abstract: Allows dynamic access to the context’s options using the command’s signature’s keypaths.

Extensions/CommandContext/Options.html.name: Options
Extensions/CommandContext/Options.html.abstract: A type safe container for a CommandContext options that supports dynamic access.

Extensions/CommandContext/Arguments.html.name: Arguments
Extensions/CommandContext/Arguments.html.abstract: A type safe container for a CommandContext arguments that supports dynamic access.

Enums/OptionType.html#/s:10ConsoleKit10O.name: value(default:)
Enums/OptionType.html#/s:10ConsoleKit10O.abstract: Normal option. Requires a value if supplied and there is no default.

Enums/OptionType.html#/s:10ConsoleKit10O.name: flag
Enums/OptionType.html#/s:10ConsoleKit10O.abstract: Flag option. Does not support a value. If supplied, the value is true.

Enums/ConsoleClear.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0.name: screen
Enums/ConsoleClear.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0.abstract: Clears the entire viewable area of the Console.

Enums/ConsoleClear.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0.name: line
Enums/ConsoleClear.html#/s:10ConsoleKit0.abstract: Deletes the last line that was printed to the Console.

Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.name: ready
Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.abstract: Default state. This is usually never used other than for initialization.

Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.name: active(tick:)
Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.abstract: Active state. The indicator should appear active or loading during this state.

Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.name: success
Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.abstract: Success state. The indicator should show that the operation succeeded.

Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.name: failure
Enums/ActivityIndicatorState.html#/s:10C.abstract: Fail state. The indicator should show that the operation failed.

Classes/ActivityIndicator.html#/s:10Cons.name: start(refreshRate:)
Classes/ActivityIndicator.html#/s:10Cons.abstract: Starts the ActivityIndicator. Usually this means beginning the associated loading animation.

Classes/ActivityIndicator.html#/s:10Cons.name: fail()
Classes/ActivityIndicator.html#/s:10Cons.abstract: Stops the ActivityIndicator, yielding a failed / error appearance.

Classes/ActivityIndicator.html#/s:10Cons.name: succeed()
Classes/ActivityIndicator.html#/s:10Cons.abstract: Stops the ActivityIndicator, yielding a success / done appearance.

Classes/ActivityIndicator.html.name: ActivityIndicator
Classes/ActivityIndicator.html.abstract: An instance of a ActivityIndicatorType that can be started, failed, and succeeded.

Classes/Terminal.html.name: Terminal
Classes/Terminal.html.abstract: Generic console that uses a mixture of Swift standard

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
